meanings.definition: To avoid or escape from someone or something by cunning or skill.
meanings.sent1: The clever fox was able to eluder the hunter by hiding in the bushes.
meanings.sent2: She always manages to eluder difficult situations with her quick thinking.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat seemed to enjoy trying to eluder the dog chasing after it.
meanings.sent4: The elusive thief continued to eluder the police, leaving no trace behind.
meanings.sent5: His ability to eluder danger made him a legend among his friends.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that eludes.
meanings.sent1: The mysterious eluder in the forest was rumored to be a ghost.
meanings.sent2: The solution to the puzzle remained an eluder to the detective.
meanings.sent3: The clever eluder managed to escape capture once again.
meanings.sent4: The elusive eluder slipped away into the shadows, leaving everyone baffled.
meanings.sent5: The legendary eluder was known for always staying one step ahead.
